channel.title: Running a Client on Windows 7?
channel.description:
Well, this is going to sound incredibly stupid.
But what is the code for the run.bat for a 317 client?
The one I originally had for my Client is:
[code]@echo off title Client java -Xmx300m -classpath bin client 10 0 highmem members 32 pause[/code]
All the ones I used to use for windows XP no longer work, ( I upgraded to Windows 7 )
I get this error when I click run.
[code]'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Yes I have J.R.E Yes I have J.D.K ( AND IT'S THE NEWEST ONE )
Can anyone help?

item.title: Running a Client on Windows 7?

item.description:
@simdog wrote:

I cant run 317 on Ubuntu idk y either i had to change 508 lient for it to work but 317 ioi change but i crash after 2 clicks

item.title: Running a Client on Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @_Yummeh _Yummeh_
item.description:
@_Yummeh wrote:

Neither of the fixes worked. =.=
I’ll try that Program now.

[br]

Ok I I used that Java EV Setter, and it still wont work, even with the new codes.

Read full topic

item.title: Running a Client on Windows 7?
item.description:
@1980 wrote:

Lol this is why i reinstalled windows 7 sucks heres the fix try either one

@echo off
cls
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx300m -classpath bin client 10 0 highmem members 32
Gui
exit
pause

@echo off
cls
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar
Gui
exit
pause

also I don’t know how to do that little Code: thing so just use these lol
So just replace your run.bat for 317 clients it should work

Read full topic

item.title: Running a Client on Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

Have you set your Environment Variables for JDK? If not, refer to the EV Setter which is stickied in the Server Downloads Section.

Read full topic
